data.title: Sushil Rao Ch on LinkedIn: Renowned filmmaker and artist B Narsing Rao garu visited the batik art…
data.meta_description: Renowned filmmaker and artist B Narsing Rao garu visited the batik art exhibition of my wife Maria Clara. Narsing Rao garu is the producer of “Maa Bhoomi”…
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Renowned filmmaker and artist B Narsing Rao garu visited the batik art exhibition of my wife Maria Clara. Narsing Rao garu is the producer of “Maa Bhoomi” released in the year 1979. A poet, music composer and a writer, his films received international acclaim. He directed “Rangula Kala” , “Daasi” “Matti Manushulu” and “Harvillu”. It was a great learning experience from him as he spent time going around the gallery. He looked at each and every painting and discussed about thrm. During his early years as an artist, he also did batik art. Maria Clara’s “The Vigil” in Batik exhibition is organised by the Department of Language and Culture at Chitramayee State Gallery of Art, Madhapur, Hyderabad. Telangana State Film Development Corporation chairman Anil Kurmachalam inaugurated the exhibition on Feb 3. Director, Department of Language and Culture Mamidi Harikrishna was the guest of honour. The exhibition is on view till February 9, 2023 from 11 am to 7 pm.
